page.title: 06THE PARISH COUNCIL
page.content: The{Parish of Sherston, Wilts,} which includes the hamlets of Willesley & Pinkney, has an electoral role of 1121. It has budgeted and raised Â£4500 in the current financial year. The council consists of 13 elected voluntary councillors and one part_time paid clerk. Meetings take place monthly and a small number of parishioners usually attend. It has a{committee structure covering :_ Planning; Environmental; Sports field & Recreation ground;& Allotments.Councillors also serve on _ Sherston Community Centre_County Bus Service Users_ Primary School governor & local trusts.The Council is studying the draft. N. Wilts Rural Area local plan for further housing development in the village, with which many parishioners disagree.
